column4: I have a problem with Update manager: "The package 'brscan' is in an inconsistent state and needs to be resinstalled, but no archive can be found for it. Do you want to remove it now to continue?"
When I click 'yes' it whirls away, but doesn't remove it. I'm offered to reinstall it. However, I cannot as dpkg complains
its like some Catch-22. Can someone help?
I have a problem with Update manager: "The package 'brscan' is in an inconsistent state and needs to be resinstalled, but no archive can be found for it. Do you want to remove it now to continue?"
When I click 'yes' it whirls away, but doesn't remove it. I'm offered to reinstall it. However, I cannot as dpkg complains
anyone?
in terminal try sudo apt-get -f install
did your try "sudo apt-get install --reinstall brscan" in terminal? Or "sudo dpkg --configure -a"
that's the catch-22 it won't let me reinstall either
--configure -a no, haven't tried
its a .deb file
sudo dpkg --reinstall brscan3-0.2.11-2.i386.deb ?
did you try just with "sudo dpkg -i filename"
i fear no one is listening
try "sudo dpgk --purge brscan"
http://pastebin.com/t5hAsm8y
dpkg: error processing brscan (--purge): subprocess installed pre-removal script returned error exit status 127
whats with "sudo dpgk --purge --force-depends brscan"
/var/lib/dpkg/info/brscan.postinst: 3: /usr/local/Brother/sane/setupSaneScan: not found
subprocess installed post-installation script returned error exit status 127
could you fix your problem?
almost, but in the end no
i removed things from var/dpgk, which fixed dpkg but in the end when i want to reinstall brother drivers I end up in a mess again
ok i see
